title: Ticket #2705: condor_schedd misreports submitter ads for running jobs on restart
description:
Description of problem:
So a relatively subtle fairshare issue has been affecting us due to our schedd
stability issues lately.  This is what I believe to be going on:

* Jobs for a particular AccountingGroup are running in a condor_schedd.
* The submitter add for the jobs reports running & idle jobs with Name equal to
the AccountingGroup, and there's another submitter ad with the Name equal the
User attribute of the jobs but 0 for running/idle/held.
* The schedd dies and is restarted
* The running jobs are reported in a submitter ad with Name equal to User, not
Name equal to AccountingGroup.  The submitter ad with Name equal to
AccountingGroup shows idle jobs but 0 running jobs.
* During the negotiation cycle the negotiator sees 0 running jobs for the group
and allocates slots for additional jobs.  When it connects to the schedd it
sees a larger number of jobs running than shares were initialized for, decided
the group has received enough allocation, and doesn't dispatch any more jobs to
it.  A "trapped" AccountingGroup can often receive no other jobs until existing
running jobs finish.

The misreporting submitter ad is a fairly severe bug due to the fairshare
miscaluation and how new job dispatching is blocked until job completion.  Can
you kindly repro this and look at providing us a patch?
remarks:
Root cause is that the schedd does not properly restore accounting group info on restart.

REPRO/TEST:

Using the following config: 

NEGOTIATOR_DEBUG = D_FULLDEBUG
NEGOTIATOR_USE_SLOT_WEIGHTS = FALSE
NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL = 30

SCHEDD_INTERVAL	= 15

CLAIM_WORKLIFE = 0

NUM_CPUS = 10

# turn off round robin and multiple allocation rounds
HFS_ROUND_ROBIN_RATE = 100000000
HFS_MAX_ALLOCATION_ROUNDS = 1

GROUP_NAMES = a, b

GROUP_QUOTA_a = 5
GROUP_QUOTA_b = 5

GROUP_ACCEPT_SURPLUS = FALSE
GROUP_AUTOREGROUP = FALSE

Submit the following job (you may wish to replace 'eje' with your username) 

universe = vanilla
cmd = /bin/sleep
args = 6000
should_transfer_files = if_needed
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit
+AccountingGroup="a.eje"
queue 5

After the jobs negotiate, you should see submitter 'a.eje' with 5 jobs running: 

$ condor_status -submitter
Name                 Machine      Running IdleJobs HeldJobs

a.eje@localdomain    localhost.         5        0        0
                           RunningJobs           IdleJobs           HeldJobs

   a.eje@localdomain                 5                  0                  0

               Total                 5                  0                  0

Now restart the schedd: 

$ condor_restart -schedd

Before the fix: After schedd restarts, you will see that the jobs have been improperly re-constituted with submitter 'eje' instead of 'a.eje': 

$ condor_status -submitter

Name                 Machine      Running IdleJobs HeldJobs

a.eje@localdomain    localhost.         0        0        0
eje@localdomain      localhost.         5        0        0
                           RunningJobs           IdleJobs           HeldJobs

   a.eje@localdomain                 0                  0                  0
     eje@localdomain                 5                  0                  0

               Total                 5                  0                  0

After the fix: if you repeat the repro steps above, you should see that after the schedd is restarted, the jobs are correctly reconstituted with 'a.eje' for the submitter name: 

$ condor_status -submitter

Name                 Machine      Running IdleJobs HeldJobs

a.eje@localdomain    localhost.         5        0        0
                           RunningJobs           IdleJobs           HeldJobs

   a.eje@localdomain                 5                  0                  0

               Total                 5                  0                  0
